name: reticulum-meshchat
description: A simple mesh network communications app powered by the Reticulum Network Stack.
readme_summary: Reticulum MeshChat is a simple mesh network communications application built on the Reticulum Network Stack. It allows users to send messages, files, and audio calls over various interfaces, including local networks, the internet, and LoRa radio, with a focus on secure communication and compatibility with other LXMF clients like Sideband and Nomadnet.
key_features: Sending and receiving messages, files, and audio calls
Communication over Ethernet, WiFi, internet, and LoRa radio
Secure communication with message encryption
Compatibility with LXMF clients (Sideband, Nomadnet)
File downloading and browsing of micron pages on Nomad Network
LXMF Propagation Node support
Audio Calls with codec2 encoding
primary_use_case: Off-grid and decentralized communication using mesh networks.
cover_image_prompt: An old-fashioned switchboard operator in a cozy, steampunk-inspired office, connecting glowing wires between various devices: a vintage radio, a modern smartphone, and a computer displaying a chat interface. The wires converge on a central mesh network represented by a glowing, interconnected web. The operator smiles, symbolizing seamless communication across different networks. Subtle UI elements on the devices show message exchanges. The scene is warmly lit with soft shadows. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style with a focus on clear lines and intricate details.

name: vt-cli
readme_summary: The VirusTotal CLI is a command-line tool that allows users to interact with the VirusTotal API. It provides functionalities such as retrieving information about files, URLs, domains, and IP addresses, as well as searching for threats, downloading files, and managing LiveHunt YARA rules.
key_features: Retrieve information about files, URLs, domain names, and IP addresses
Search for files and URLs using VirusTotal Intelligence query syntax
Download files
Manage LiveHunt YARA rules
Launch Retrohunt jobs and get their results
primary_use_case: Interacting with the VirusTotal service via the command line for security analysis and threat intelligence.
cover_image_prompt: A detective in a dimly lit office, using a magnifying glass (the vt-cli) to examine digital fingerprints on various pieces of evidence (files, URLs, IP addresses). The fingerprints glow with data, revealing hidden threats. A large screen behind the detective displays a simplified VirusTotal interface with search results. Small code snippets float around the detective, subtly connecting the scene to software. The office is filled with filing cabinets labeled with VirusTotal features. The scene has a noir-inspired color scheme with dramatic lighting. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.

name: AgentGym-RL
description: Code and implementations for the paper "AgentGym-RL: Training LLM Agents for Long-Horizon Decision Making through Multi-Turn Reinforcement Learning" by Zhiheng Xi et al.
readme_summary: AgentGym-RL is a framework for training LLM agents to perform multi-turn interactive decision-making using reinforcement learning. It provides diverse real-world scenarios and supports mainstream RL algorithms, aiming to improve the performance of LLM agents in complex tasks.
key_features: Multi-turn interactive decision-making
Support for real-world scenarios
Compatibility with mainstream RL algorithms
ScalingInter-RL algorithm for optimization stability
Visualized interactive user interface for data analysis
primary_use_case: Training LLM agents for long-horizon decision-making tasks through reinforcement learning.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled navigator piloting a sophisticated ship through a vast, uncharted archipelago, representing complex, multi-turn decision-making. The ship's controls are subtly integrated with UI elements, displaying real-time data and code snippets. Each island represents a different real-world scenario, with varying challenges and rewards. The navigator uses a glowing, interactive map powered by RL algorithms to chart the optimal course. The scene is set in a vibrant, stylized world with clear skies and dynamic lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and a focus on clarity and intuitive understanding.

name: obsidian-telegram-sync
description: Transfer messages and files from Telegram to Obsidian
readme_summary: The Obsidian Telegram Sync plugin allows users to transfer messages and files from Telegram to their Obsidian vault. It supports saving text, voice transcripts, images, and other files, enabling further processing and organization of Telegram content within Obsidian.
key_features: Synchronize text messages and files
Save messages as individual notes or append to an existing note
Transcript voices and video notes (for Telegram Premium subscribers only)
Use customizable templates for new notes
Set folders for new notes and files
Automatically format text messages with markdown
Delete processed messages from Telegram
primary_use_case: Transferring and organizing Telegram messages and files within an Obsidian vault for note-taking and knowledge management.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously sorting incoming telegrams into labeled Obsidian filing cabinets. The librarian uses a special device to transcribe voice messages into text, which then neatly appears within the files. Digital particles representing data flow between a glowing Telegram icon and the Obsidian cabinets. Small UI elements showing message previews and file types float subtly in the background. The scene is set in a well-lit, organized library with a warm, inviting atmosphere. The composition is clean and focused with a blue and gray color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
